subject: JUnit Setup in JBuilder (Was: [junit] Thanks)
msgSnippet: Put it into a nutshell, there are two key features in JBuilder can help you, which are both my favorite: 1. In the library setup, you can specify the source
messageBody:
Put it into a nutshell, there are two key features in JBuilder can help you, which are both my favorite:

1. In the library setup, you can specify the source code for the library file. And the source code can be a jar file. The fact is, you can even
browse the jar file as if it is a folder in the file chooser. This is useful for the library source code browsing without extracting the file.

2. In the project properties, you can specify more than one source code directory. So you can have a directory for the real code and another one
for the testing code. I think JBuilder will put all the generated file into the first directory so the way I am doing is just to create a dummy
file through windows explorer (File --> New --> Text Document then change the name) in the second directory.

As to the question of putting class file differently, I don't think you can do that in JBuilder. So I wrote a script that will compile only the
real source folder into a totally different directory and do the archiving and stuff. I registered the batch file in Tools --> Configure Tools
menu so that I can call it from JBuilder directly.

> > > navigate

> > > fill
